attributes.action: Limit the number of corporate tickets at sporting events
attributes.additional_details:
I propose that a limit should be placed on the number of corporate tickets at sporting events. In accordance with the capacity of the stadia/venue, a maximum of 20% of all tickets should go to corporate sales. This would give 80% for the general public (fans of the sport/teams).

Recent issues with Olympic tickets highlights something needs to be done. Top events are having over 50% of the venue filled with corporate tickets. Wembley stadium for the FA cup final had 40,000 corporate seats, only 25,000 seats each for the fans of the supporting team.
